title: Looking for a gothic sans w/ slightly rounded corners - can you help?
content:
Hello, I'm looking for a font with slightly rounded corners. I need regular, bold and heavy versions. I want it to look a bit like the attached font - which was designed for UKTV and therefor not for sale. It has a modern feel but is very structured and regular in design. I like the fact it does not feel condensed.

Can anyone help? Thanks.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [home.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140801214822/http:/typophile.com/files/home_0.jpg) | 66.82 KB |
author: aaronhinchion

comments.content:
\> _(...) designed for UKTV and therefore not for sale._

Hmmm, [how peculiar...](http://web.archive.org/web/20140801214822/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/gotham/index.html)
C'mon Yves. Don't be so coy. Say it. ;^)
Say Aaron, do you know who did this custom font? The designer or agency?
I always assumed that UKTV did use gotham, but seeing that example I can see a very slight difference in the style.
To my eyes I'd say their typeface began with Gotham. I'd also love to know who did the typeface for UKTV.

You should look at [Houschka](http://web.archive.org/web/20140801214822/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=GTT0000007). The corners are rounded, but not very noticeably. Nick Cooke, the designer, posts here. Maybe he can set you up with a .pdf to look at it more closely...
Stradfonts custom made the font. I called the designer up and he nearly bit my head off.
I will guess that this won't be one of the fonts they publish in their custom fonts section.

\> _I called the designer up and he nearly bit my head off._

I wonder what he'll do when Hoefler & Frere-Jones call him up. :^P
Thanks to the long-entrenched tradition of "inspired" work in faces, likely nothing.
